Package com.example.recipeoop_1.service

Class RecipeServiceImpl

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.service.RecipeServiceImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
RecipeService
@Service public class RecipeServiceImpl extends Object implements RecipeService
Implementation of the RecipeService interface.

This service class provides the concrete logic for managing recipes, including CRUD operations and various search functionalities. It interacts directly with MongoTemplate for database operations and uses CategoryService to manage recipe categories, which are stored as separate MongoDB collections (e.g., "recipe_desserts").

Since:
2025-05-14

  • Constructor Details

    • RecipeServiceImpl

      @Autowired public RecipeServiceImpl(org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate mongoTemplate, CategoryService categoryService)
      Constructs a RecipeServiceImpl with the necessary dependencies.
      Parameters:
      mongoTemplate - The Spring Data MongoTemplate for direct MongoDB interaction.
      categoryService - The CategoryService for managing category-specific logic, such as ensuring category collections exist and formatting names.

  • Method Details

    • createRecipe

      public Recipe createRecipe(Recipe recipeDetails, String username)
      Creates a new recipe and associates it with the given username.

      The implementation should handle persisting the recipe details and linking it to the user who created it. It may also involve ensuring the specified category exists or is created.

      This implementation sets the creator's username on the recipe. It ensures that a MongoDB collection exists for the recipe's category (creating it if necessary via CategoryService.ensureCategoryExists(String)). If the category is null or empty, it defaults to "uncategorized". The recipe is then inserted into the appropriately named collection (e.g., "recipe_main_course").

      Specified by:
      createRecipe in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      recipeDetails - The Recipe object containing the details of the recipe to be created. Must not be null.
      username - The username of the user creating the recipe. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The created and persisted Recipe object, typically including its generated ID.

    • getAllRecipes

      public List<Recipe> getAllRecipes()
      Retrieves a list of all recipes available in the system, across all categories.

      This implementation iterates through all known category collections (obtained via CategoryService.getAllCategories()), fetches all recipes from each, and aggregates them into a single list.

      Specified by:
      getAllRecipes in interface RecipeService
      Returns:
      A List of all Recipe objects. Returns an empty list if no recipes exist.

    • getRecipeById

      public Recipe getRecipeById(String category, String id)
      Retrieves a specific recipe by its category and unique identifier (ID).

      This implementation retrieves a recipe from the MongoDB collection corresponding to the given category name. The category name is first formatted using CategoryService.formatCollectionName(String).

      Specified by:
      getRecipeById in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      category - The category name in which to search for the recipe. Must not be null or empty.
      id - The unique ID of the recipe to retrieve. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The found Recipe, or null if not found in the specified category.

    • getRecipeById

      public Recipe getRecipeById(String id) throws RecipeNotFoundException
      Retrieves a specific recipe by its unique identifier (ID), searching across all categories.

      This implementation iterates through all known category collections. For each category, it attempts to find the recipe using getRecipeById(String, String). The first matching recipe found is returned.

      Specified by:
      getRecipeById in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the recipe to retrieve. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      The found Recipe object.
      Throws:
      RecipeNotFoundException - if the recipe with the given ID is not found in any category.

    • updateRecipe

      public Recipe updateRecipe(String id, Recipe recipeDetails) throws RecipeNotFoundException
      Updates an existing recipe identified by its ID with new details.

      The implementation should find the existing recipe, apply the changes from recipeDetails, and persist the updated recipe. It may also need to handle changes in category, potentially moving the recipe between underlying storage structures.

      This implementation first retrieves the existing recipe using getRecipeById(String). If the category of the recipe has changed in recipeDetails, the existing recipe is deleted from its old category collection, its ID is cleared (to allow MongoDB to generate a new one if necessary, though typically for updates the ID should be preserved if possible, this logic might need review if ID preservation across category moves is critical), and then it's re-created in the new category's collection using createRecipe(Recipe, String). If the category has not changed, the recipe is updated in place within its current collection by setting its properties and calling MongoTemplate.save(Object, String).

      Specified by:
      updateRecipe in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the recipe to update. Must not be null or empty.
      recipeDetails - A Recipe object containing the new details for the recipe. Must not be null.
      Returns:
      The updated Recipe object.
      Throws:
      RecipeNotFoundException - if the recipe to update is not found.

    • deleteRecipe

      public void deleteRecipe(String id) throws RecipeNotFoundException
      Deletes a recipe from the system based on its unique identifier (ID).

      The implementation should ensure the recipe is removed from persistence.

      This implementation first retrieves the recipe using getRecipeById(String) to determine its category. Then, it constructs a query to remove the recipe from the appropriate category-specific collection using MongoTemplate.remove(Query, Class, String).

      Specified by:
      deleteRecipe in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      id - The unique ID of the recipe to delete. Must not be null or empty.
      Throws:
      RecipeNotFoundException - if the recipe to delete is not found.

    • getRecipesByUser

      public List<Recipe> getRecipesByUser(String username)
      Retrieves all recipes created by a specific user.

      This implementation iterates through all known category collections, queries each for recipes where the createdBy field matches the given username, and aggregates the results.

      Specified by:
      getRecipesByUser in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the user whose recipes are to be retrieved. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects created by the specified user. Returns an empty list if the user has not created any recipes or if the user does not exist.

    • searchRecipesByTitle

      public List<Recipe> searchRecipesByTitle(String title)
      Searches for recipes whose titles contain the given keyword. The search should ideally be case-insensitive.

      This implementation iterates through all category collections, performing a case-insensitive regular expression search on the title field within each collection. All matching recipes are aggregated.

      Specified by:
      searchRecipesByTitle in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      title - The keyword to search for within recipe titles.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects whose titles match the keyword. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • searchRecipesByCategory

      public List<Recipe> searchRecipesByCategory(String category)
      Retrieves all recipes belonging to a specific category.

      This implementation formats the given category name to a collection name using CategoryService.formatCollectionName(String). If the collection exists, it retrieves all recipes from that collection. Otherwise, it returns an empty list.

      Specified by:
      searchRecipesByCategory in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      category - The category name to filter recipes by. Must not be null or empty.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects within the specified category. Returns an empty list if the category does not exist or contains no recipes.

    • searchRecipesByCookingTime

      public List<Recipe> searchRecipesByCookingTime(Integer cookingTime)
      Searches for recipes with a cooking time less than or equal to the specified number of minutes.

      This implementation iterates through all category collections, querying each for recipes where the cookingTime field is less than or equal to (lte) the specified time. All matching recipes are aggregated.

      Specified by:
      searchRecipesByCookingTime in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      cookingTime - The maximum cooking time in minutes. Must be a non-negative integer.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects that meet the cooking time criteria. Returns an empty list if no such recipes are found.

    • searchRecipesByIngredient

      public List<Recipe> searchRecipesByIngredient(String ingredient)
      Searches for recipes that contain a specific ingredient. The search should ideally be case-insensitive and match partial ingredient names.

      This implementation iterates through all category collections, performing a case-insensitive regular expression search on the ingredients array/list field within each collection. All matching recipes are aggregated.

      Specified by:
      searchRecipesByIngredient in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      ingredient - The ingredient keyword to search for within the recipe's ingredients list.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects that contain the specified ingredient. Returns an empty list if no matches are found.

    • advancedSearch

      public List<Recipe> advancedSearch(String title, String category, Integer maxCookingTime, String ingredient)
      Performs an advanced search for recipes based on multiple optional criteria.

      Allows searching by any combination of title, category, maximum cooking time, and ingredient. If a criterion is null or empty (for strings), it should be ignored in the search.

      This implementation builds a dynamic MongoDB Query. If a specific category is provided and not empty, the search is confined to that category's collection. Otherwise, it iterates through all category collections, applying the filter criteria (title, maxCookingTime, ingredient) to each. All criteria are optional and are added to the query only if provided. Searches involving text (title, ingredient) are case-insensitive.

      Specified by:
      advancedSearch in interface RecipeService
      Parameters:
      title - Optional: A keyword to search for in recipe titles.
      category - Optional: The category name to filter by.
      maxCookingTime - Optional: The maximum cooking time in minutes.
      ingredient - Optional: An ingredient keyword to search for.
      Returns:
      A List of Recipe objects that match all provided criteria. Returns an empty list if no recipes match the combined criteria.
